answers.answer:
The main purpose of vaccination for health is to preserve human health and life by protecting individuals from deadly infectious diseases and preventing dangerous complications. It is the only way to protect against these diseases and avoid severe outcomes.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the entire section under the "Vaccination" heading.

answers.answer:
Vaccination can prevent infectious diseases such as measles, rubella, polio, diphtheria, haemophilus influenza type b (Hib), tuberculosis, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, mumps, rotavirus, pneumococcal infection, influenza, COVID-19, fungal infections, and meningococcal infection.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section titled 'Vaccination'.
answers.bResponse:

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section titled 'Vaccination'. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination

answers.answer:
Newborns should be vaccinated against Hepatitis B and tuberculosis (BCG) immediately after birth if vaccines are available. If not, these vaccinations should be obtained as soon as possible, with Hepatitis B vaccination starting when the child weighs 2 kilograms or is 1 month old.

You can find this information on the website dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination under the main "Vaccination" section, specifically where it discusses the "Calendar of mandatory vaccinations in Romania" and recommendations for newborns.

answers.answer:
If a child has missed scheduled vaccinations, make up for the schedule as soon as possible by contacting your nearest County Department for Public Health or healthcare provider for free vaccinations. It is not necessary to start all vaccinations from the beginning; instead, schedule the next vaccines with your doctor, ensuring to follow the recommended dose intervals.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the general text under the "Vaccination" heading, as well as the bullet points under the "Important to remember!" section.

Yes, adults can also receive vaccinations. The text explicitly states that vaccinating both children and adults is the only way to protect against infectious diseases and prevent dangerous complications, and specifically mentions that adults should be vaccinated, including against COVID-19.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read the section on "Vaccination".

answers.answer:
Yes, vaccination against COVID-19 is recommended for adults. It is advised to protect yourself from diseases that can be avoided by getting vaccinated, and if you or your loved ones do not have a full course of COVID-19 vaccination, you should contact a healthcare provider.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read under the section titled "COVID-19".

answers.answer:
Yes, multiple vaccines can be administered simultaneously. This is a common international practice, and multicomponent vaccines can reduce the number of injections while providing protection against several infections.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and scroll down to the "Important to remember!" section. The third bullet point in that section provides this detail.

answers.answer:
Vaccination is safe for individuals with chronic illnesses like asthma or diabetes; it is not a contraindication, and such individuals are at a higher risk of severe infections that can be protected against by vaccination.

To find more detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and read under the "Important to remember!" section, specifically the bullet point that discusses chronic illness.

answers.answer:
No, vaccination does not weaken the immune system. Instead, it helps protect against diseases, and vaccines are designed not to overload the immune system.

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination and look under the "Important to remember!" section, specifically the bullet point that begins with "Vaccination cannot weaken the immune system."

answers.answer:
For a polio outbreak, ensure your child receives at least two IPV doses. For a rubella outbreak, protect your child with the first dose of MMR (measles-mumps-rubella) vaccine at 12 months.

To find this information on the webpage, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination` and read the content under the "Vaccination" section. The specific advice regarding polio and rubella outbreaks is located towards the end of the main text, under the "Important to remember!" bullet points.

answers.answer:
In most cases, premature babies (born before 37 weeks of gestation) should be vaccinated at the same age and on the same schedule as full-term babies, regardless of birth weight. However, Hepatitis B vaccination should be started when the child weighs 2 kilograms or is 1 month old.

To find this information on the webpage, visit `https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination` and read the section that discusses the vaccination calendar and specific guidelines for newborns and infants.

The provided summary advises that if you go abroad, you will be offered a vaccination and encourages you not to refuse or delay this opportunity, but it does not specify which vaccinations are recommended for international travel.

To find detailed information on vaccinations recommended for international travel, you would need to consult travel health advisories from official health organizations or speak with a healthcare provider specializing in travel medicine, as this specific list is not provided in the summary or on the linked page.
